Basic EPS is computed by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period, without consideration for common stock equivalents. Diluted EPS is computed by dividing net income by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period and the weighted-average number of dilutive common stock equivalents outstanding for the period determined using the treasury-stock method.
For purposes of this calculation, common stock options, restricted stock units and restricted stock awards are considered to be common stock equivalents and are only included in the calculation of diluted EPS when their effect is dilutive. In periods in which the Company has a net loss, dilutive common stock equivalents are excluded from the calculation of diluted EPS.

We believe that excluding these expenses facilitates comparisons of our operating performance on a period-to-period basis and, in the case of exclusion of acquisition-related expense and certain historical legal expenses, excludes items that we do not consider to be indicative of our core operating performance. We calculate net income by subtracting revenue from cost of revenue, and the costs of revenue in our calculation of net income include depreciation and amortization of our tangible assets and certain acquisition-related expenses. We do not include the costs of revenue in our calculation of net income because such costs are generally capital expenditures and are not incurred in connection with the sale of our products. The costs of revenue that we exclude from our calculation of net income are: (a) legal expenses; (b) certain acquisition-related expenses; (c) certain historical expenses; and (d) certain other expenses.
